types.name: Consumer
types.description: Fireworks intended for recreational use during holiday celebrations

types.name: Display
types.description: Fireworks that require a licensed operator to discharge a show of these fireworks

types.name: Novelty
types.description: Smaller fireworks often for children or parties, legality varries from state to state

types.name: Primary Explosives
types.description: An explosive that is sensitive to friction, blows, shock, or heat

types.name: Secondary Explosives
types.description: An explosive that combusts nearly instantaneously, thereby producing a violent, shattering effect.

types.name: Tertiary Explosives
types.description: so insensitive to shock that they cannot be reliably detonated by practical quantities of primary explosive, and instead require an intermediate explosive booster of secondary explosive.
